PageTitle: display bgp flow ipv6 routing-table peer advertised-routes
FuncDef: The display bgp flow ipv6 routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays information about BGP IPv6 Flow Specification routes.
CLIs: display bgp flow ipv6 routing-table peer { <ipv6-address> | <ipv4-address> } advertised-routes <reindex>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays detailed information about the route of a specified index.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 address.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: Status codes: * - valid, > - best, d - damped, x - best external, a - add path,
h - history,  i - internal, s - suppressed, S - Stale
Origin : i - IGP, e - EGP,   - incomplete
RPKI validation codes: V - valid, I - invalid, N - not-found
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check information about BGP IPv6 Flow Specification routes, run the display bgp flow ipv6 routing-table peer advertised-routes command.
